workflow.name: Automate LinkedIn comment replies with GPT-3.5 & track in Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow automates LinkedIn community engagement by monitoring post comments, filtering new ones, generating AI-powered replies, and posting responses directly on LinkedIn. It also logs all interactions into Google Sheets for tracking and analytics.

## Step-by-step

**Trigger & Fetch**

- A Schedule Trigger runs the workflow every 10 minutes.

- The workflow fetches the latest comments on a specific LinkedIn post using LinkedIn‚Äôs API with token-based authentication.

**Filter for New Comments**

- Retrieves the timestamp of the last processed comment from Google Sheets.

- Filters out previously handled comments, ensuring only fresh interactions are processed.

**AI-Powered Reply Generation**

- Sends the new comment to OpenAI GPT-3.5 Turbo with a structured prompt.

- AI generates a professional, concise, and engaging LinkedIn-appropriate reply (max 2‚Äì3 sentences).

**Post Back to LinkedIn**

- Automatically posts the AI-generated reply under the original comment thread.

- Maintains consistent formatting and actor identity.

**Data Logging**

- Appends the original comment, AI response, and metadata into Google Sheets.

- Enables tracking, review, and future engagement analysis.

## Benefits

- Saves time by automating LinkedIn comment replies.

- Ensures responses are timely, professional, and on-brand.

- Maintains authentic engagement without manual effort.

- Prevents duplicate replies by filtering with timestamps.

- Creates a structured log in Google Sheets for auditing and analytics.

values.content:
You are a helpful social media manager. Generate a professional and engaging reply to the following LinkedIn comment. Keep it concise, positive, and appropriate for business networking.

Original comment: {{ $json.message.text }}

Reply should be:
- Professional but friendly
- Maximum 2-3 sentences
- Thank the commenter or acknowledge their input
- Add value or continue the conversation naturally

parameters.content:
## Nodes Covered: LinkedIn API, Scheduling, Google Sheet

üìÖ Note:

AUTOMATED LINKEDIN COMMENT MONITORING

*Fetches comments from a specific LinkedIn post every 10 minutes using LinkedIn's API. It authenticates via header-based token access and ensures updated responses by scheduling regular runs.*

*And also reads timestamps of the comments from the sheet*

## Nodes Covered: Data Filtering

üìä Note:

DYNAMIC COMMENT FILTERING

*Retrieves the timestamp of the last processed comment from a Google Sheet, and filters out already-handled entries to focus only on newly received comments.*

## Nodes Covered: OpenAI Analysis

üß† Note:

AI-GENERATED LINKEDIN ENGAGEMENT

*Uses OpenAI (GPT-3.5 Turbo) to generate friendly and professional replies to new LinkedIn comments. Prompts are structured to ensure tone, brevity, and contextual relevance for networking.*

## Nodes Covered: LinkedIn API, AI Output Delivery

üí¨ Note:

AUTOMATED COMMENT REPLY POSTING

*Takes AI-generated replies and posts them back to LinkedIn as responses under the original comment thread, maintaining the actor identity and message formatting.*

## Nodes Covered: Google Sheets (Write)

üíæ Note:

COMMENT DATA ARCHIVAL

*Appends processed LinkedIn comments and associated metadata into a structured Google Sheet for tracking, review, or future analytics.*

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
